definitions.definition: To change a text , or a document .
examples: Your speech is too long. You need to edit it.

definitions.definition: To alter a photograph or recording of sound or video .
examples: We shot an hour-long interview then edited it down to 45 minutes.

definitions.definition: To be the editor of a publication.
To change the contents of a file , website , etc.
examples: Wikipedia is an interactive encyclopedia which allows anybody to edit and improve articles.

definitions.definition: To alter the DNA sequence of a chromosome ; to perform gene splicing .
To assemble a film by cutting and splicing raw footage .
To cut short or otherwise alter an improvised scene.
To lend itself to editing in a certain way.

main_definition: To change a text , or a document .
secondary_definitions: To alter a photograph or recording of sound or video .
( transitive ) To be the editor of a publication.
( computing ) To change the contents of a file , website , etc.
( biology ) To alter the DNA sequence of a chromosome ; to perform gene splicing .
To assemble a film by cutting and splicing raw footage .
( comedy ) To cut short or otherwise alter an improvised scene.
( ergative ) To lend itself to editing in a certain way.
